subject: Gardening
title: Marigolds: The Universal Companion
description: A fast breakdown of Marigolds: The Universal Companion for builders.

hook.text: Marigolds are the most recommended companion plant in the world. Some claims are real. Others are myth.

buildup.text: French marigolds produce alpha-terthienyl, a chemical toxic to root-knot nematodes living in soil.

discovery.text: Studies confirm marigolds suppress nematodes when grown as a cover cropâ€”but only after several months of growth.

twist.text: The claim that marigolds repel most garden pests above ground has weak evidence. Their power is mainly underground.

climax.text: Marigolds are proven nematode fighters. Their above-ground pest claims are exaggerated but their soil benefits are real.

punchline.text: Marigolds work underground better than above ground.

quiz.question: What is scientifically proven about marigolds as companion plants?
options: They repel all common garden insects with their scent
They suppress root-knot nematodes in soil through chemical compounds
They attract beneficial butterflies that pollinate vegetables
